references.name: Maciej Pastuszka, Senior JavaScript Developer & Team Lead in SYZYGY, Warsaw
references.reference: As the project coordinator, Tomasz showed professionalism, he was able to skillfully plan activities that would translate into results and lead to the intended goal. In addition to team management skills, Tomasz showed knowledge in the field of IT. The combination of these skills contributed not only to the achievement of the goals of the project but also to the development of the members of which Tomasz was the coordinator.

work.summary: Europe’s finest custom software development company. More than 10 years of experience, over 630 developers and designers specializing in software development, mobile development and product design.
work.name: Netguru
work.position: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer & Team Leader
highlights: Project #2: A platform very similar to LinkedIn, but accessible via invitation only.

Responsibilities: implementing a functionality that enables user to add/remove job opportunity, to/from watching list, integrating application with Segment.io + implementing custom analytics events on backend, developing API for frontend part of the app, implementing a robust search engine with Searchkick and Elasticsearch, refactoring legacy code + improving code quality and test coverage, implementing multiple user type architecture, implementing a CSV importer for adding new users to the platform, designing and implementing state machine structures for most common models, implementing referrals mechanism.
Project #1: An exclusive career marketplace that connects high-potential candidates to top-tier employers in a streamlined and more effective way.

Responsibilities: integrating new design with already existing platform, setuping staging environment and deployment with Capistrano, fixing bugs in frontend and backend part, improving code quality by strong app refactoring, speeding up app by optimizing database queries, cleaning codebase by removing legacy code, implementing a panel to add career offers visible on homepage, implementing a dashboard statistics panel to show users activity, fixing security issues, introducing decorators and service object patterns, implement tracking user activity services, introducing page objects pattern and implementing features specs.

work.summary: Europe’s finest custom software development company. More than 10 years of experience, over 630 developers and designers specializing in software development, mobile development and product design.
work.name: Netguru
highlights: Project #2: A career development platform for job-seeking, recruitment and learning for users from emerging economies such as Africa.

Responsibilities: implementing sending email invitations secured with tokens, main functionalities in the platform like work experience references and skill references, campaign creation multistep form, messaging system using Mailboxer gem, optimizing database queries to avoid performance issues.
Project #1: Application for passive recruitment which uses external APIs to gather information about candidates and employers looking for new talents.

Responsibilities: designing and implementing main app's architecture, architecture for API clients, background processing solution using Sidekiq, simple event store solution for processing published events, module for sending daily reports via email, panels for viewing/managing resources in admin panel, monitoring for API queries in admin panel, implementing a service to divide long titles into small meaningful keywords, keeping high code quality (CC 4.0) and high test coverage (95%).

work.summary: Europe’s finest custom software development company. More than 10 years of experience, over 630 developers and designers specializing in software development, mobile development and product design.
work.name: Netguru
highlights: Project #2: Dedicated flight support management app for aviation professionals worldwide.
Responsibilities: integrating the application with Amazon S3, improving new contacts addition and editing contacts details.
Project #1: The app(s) is a system of around 16 Swiss / Austrian / German / Spanish advertising websites, much like small ads in newspapers.
Responsibilities: generating PDFs for vouchers and invoices, building validations for forms. Improving code quality and code security.
